review: I like it. I have only have 2 complaints. One: after you use it for a while, you go to remove it from the TV and it's HOT. It gets really warm after just about 20min of use. Two: it only has a few programs that you can use it with, so you can't go to FB and stream a video from there, you have to use one of the programs that it's designed to use it with. BUT it really works well. I had no issues with it streaming to my TV.

review: On the plus side, it is cheap and came with 3 months of netflix. On the down side, not many apps were supported and mirroring a device via a chrome browser, involves downloading the content to the device you want to mirror, then sending that content back to google, which in turn sends it back to the chromecast. In summary, stick with AppleTV

review: Well, after a couple hours, two TV sets, a Windows 7 computer, an Android tablet, and two routers at two different houses, I still have yet to set this thing up. This product was released way too early. By the way, you would think a CHROMEcast would work with standard CHROMEbooks, not just the Pixel model, wouldn't you? I think I will return it. I wish I had researched this a little more carefully before buying.
author: Andy

review: Works great.  Set up could not be easier, plug it into the HDMI port on your tv, plug in the USB power cord, Set up the wi-fi connection and away you go.  So far we've used the Netflix and Play Music Apps.  We've also cast from the Chrome browser on my PC with Plex.  Worked fantastic!  I think I know what I'm getting my family members for Christmas.
author: Amazon Customer

review: Great price and concept - but it only works with netflix and other for-fee services [ unless short clips on youtube is your thing ]  won't work with Amazon Prime.Was able to get it to work with limited value on the Ipad, but no joy on the laptop - and even on the website PC compatibility is BETA.Web support is very poorly organized, as is live support - Google is swamped because they did not properly vet the product, in their rush to get it out before competing products.It is not a Buy right now - unless you already have one of the fee for service vendors, only 1 device or like to own stuff that has limited functionality and don't mind wasting $35 to own it.it's a paperweight, for really small pieces of paper.Update 9.15.13 - Upgraded to Ok [ but still too pricey for what you get] Customer support responded - I needed to shutdown Vipre security and was able to connect - does not work with Amazon Prime. Tested with Break.com and Yahoo.com videoa and was able to watch videos on the TV. So it's still really only useful for YouTube or Netflix. Hopefully Google will get past BETAware on the PC Chrome interface and allow embedded players to work [ like Amazon ]
